selected_quotes: Our scientists find ATF2 suppresses tumour formation in liver cancer model
JNK messenger: ATF2 mediates tumor suppressive effects of JNK #OpenAccess

citation.abstract: JNK and p38 phosphorylate a diverse set of substrates and, consequently, can act in a context-dependent manner to either promote or inhibit tumor growth. Elucidating the functions of specific substrates of JNK and p38 is therefore critical for our understanding of these kinases in cancer. ATF2 is a phosphorylation-dependent transcription factor and substrate of both JNK and p38. Here, we show ATF2 suppresses tumor formation in an orthotopic model of liver cancer and cellular transformation in vitro. Furthermore, we find that suppression of tumorigenesis by JNK requires ATF2. We identify a transcriptional program activated by JNK via ATF2 and provide examples of JNK- and ATF2-dependent genes that block cellular transformation. Significantly, we also show that ATF2-dependent gene expression is frequently downregulated in human cancers, indicating that amelioration of JNK-ATF2-mediated suppression may be a common event during tumor development.
citation.title: JNK Suppresses Tumor Formation via a Gene-Expression Program Mediated by ATF2

news.title: Tumor-blocking role found for cell regulation molecule
news.summary: ( University of Manchester ) Manchester scientists have explored the role of a protein in regulating tumor development and found that it suppresses liver cancer growth in the lab.

weibo.summary: 【抗肝癌信号轴：JNK-ATF2】在不同的条件下，JNK可以扮演抑癌和促癌两种截然相反的角色。研究者在肝癌模型中发现，JNK抑制癌症的发生需要借助于ATF2信号：JNK会磷酸化ATF2，从而激活ATF2介导的转录通路，从而抑制癌症的发生。http://t.cn/Rz7cp9m
